Uses of Class
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.Schema

Packages that use Schema
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy Provides API to easily store records in a database, and subsequently categorize and aggregate them by a set of variables. 
 

Uses of Schema in gr.forth.ics.jbenchy
 

Methods in gr.forth.ics.jbenchy that return Schema
 Schema Schema.add(java.lang.Object variable, DataType type)
          Adds a variable to this schema with the specified data type.
 Schema Aggregator.getSchema()
          Returns the schema that stored records in this aggregator must conform to.
 

Methods in gr.forth.ics.jbenchy with parameters of type Schema
abstract  Aggregator Database.create(Schema schema, java.lang.String name)
          Returns an aggregator backed up by a created table with the given schema and name.
 Aggregator Database.forceCreate(Schema schema, java.lang.String name)
          Creates an aggregator that is backed up with a strictly new table (with the specified name) in this database and adheres to given specified schema.
 Aggregator Database.getOrCreate(Schema schema, java.lang.String name)
          Returns an aggregator with the specified schema and name, backed up with an existing table with the same name, or a new one if no such table exists.
abstract  DataType Aggregate.getResultType(Schema schema)
          Returns the type of the expected result of this aggregation, in regards to the given schema.
 java.lang.String Filter.toSql(Schema schema)
          Returns the SQL part that can be embedded in a WHERE clause and express the semantics of this filter.
 

Constructors in gr.forth.ics.jbenchy with parameters of type Schema
Schema(Schema copy)
